site.name: McGheeLab
site.mission: We build in vitro models to study the mechanisms driving metastasis.

sections.title: Why Metastasis
sections.body: Metastasis causes over 90% of cancer deaths. We study how cells sense mechanics and biochemistry as they invade, circulate, and colonize distant sites.
points: Quantify forces and flows in tumor microenvironments
Dissect cell–matrix interactions at single‑cell resolution

sections.title: Our Approach
sections.body: We engineer in vitro systems that mimic in vivo cues: microfluidics for flow, 3D bioprinting for architecture, and traction microscopy for mechanics.
points: Tight coupling of experiment and computation

sections.title: Impact
sections.body: Simple, robust assays accelerate discovery and make advanced methods accessible to more labs and classrooms.

topics.title: Microfluidics
topics.summary: Micro‑scale control of chemical and mechanical cues to study invasion, intravasation, and extravasation.

story.text: We sculpt stable chemokine gradients to probe directional migration and collective invasion dynamics.
Shear‑tunable channels model capillaries to study arrest and transmigration under physiologic flow.

topics.title: 3D Bioprinting
topics.summary: Architected ECM with spatial control over stiffness, porosity, and ligand presentation.

story.text: Layer‑by‑layer patterning yields hybrid matrices that decouple stiffness from ligand density.
Printed invasion corridors allow high‑throughput screening of anti‑metastatic compounds.

topics.title: Traction Force Microscopy
topics.summary: Quantifies how cells push/pull on their surroundings to coordinate invasion.

story.text: Bead‑embedded gels report sub‑cellular traction maps during EMT transitions.

topics.title: Bead‑based ELISA
topics.summary: Sensitive multiplexed assays to track secreted factors in microfluidic effluent.

story.text: On‑chip sample handling couples directly to bead capture, minimizing losses.

topics.title: Biomechanics
topics.summary: How stiffness, confinement, and viscoelasticity steer metastatic programs.

story.text: Micro‑ridge channels impose nuclear deformation to test mechano‑genomic responses.
Viscoelastic gels reveal time‑dependent mechanosensing distinct from purely elastic substrates.

references.title: Mechanobiology of tumor progression
references.authors: Lee P., Patel R., McGhee A.

projects.title: Tumor‑on‑a‑Chip
projects.summary: Recreates tumor–stroma–flow interactions for drug response prediction.

story.text: Integrated valves allow programmable dosing schedules and washout dynamics.
Time‑lapse invasion metrics correlate with RNA‑seq signatures of EMT.

projects.title: Open Microfluidic Pump
projects.summary: Low‑cost, PCB‑based pump for perfusion assays and classroom use.

story.text: Closed‑loop control holds flow within 2% across common head pressures.

projects.title: Mechanosensing Atlas
projects.summary: A cross‑assay map linking forces, gene programs, and phenotypes.

story.text: Joint embeddings align TFM features with transcriptomic trajectories.
